data.title: Refactoring of polygon editors to a common code base (v2)
data.body:
Follow up of #10768.

This time more compact, cleaner and focused on just deduplicating the polygon editor code. No API changes.

data.title: Bouncing/Jittering/Teleporting Collision of KinematicBody2D and StaticBody2D
data.body:
**Windows 10 64-bit, Godot version 2.1.3 and 2.1.4, Nvidia GEFORCE 940M**


**Issue description:**
I downloaded a project file, imported it into Godot, and the player kinematicBody2D began to bounce and jitter any time it came into collision with a staticBody2D object.  I expected it to just collide as it normally would on my other computer(which is a Windows 8.1 machine with Godot 2.1.3 and has an Nvidia GEFORCE 640M gaphics card)
The file I used was this:
https://github.com/NathanLovato/Godot-simple-platformer
Here is a recording of the results I get on my Windows 10 machine:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B-KAIOlp6xrhNzdUVm5Nb0lmQnc


**Steps to reproduce:**
1)Download the project provided in a link above
2)Import it into Godot
3)Run it to test
4)Flip a coin to see if it'll work on your machine or if your machine will have the same issues as mine

**Link to minimal example project:**
https://github.com/NathanLovato/Godot-simple-platformer

data.title: Fix duplication of node with script
data.body:
When duplicating node with script, properties of script weren't copied sometimes.
It happened because properties were copied in arbitrary order, and properties of the script were setted before the "script" property itself, i.e. while script is sill NULL.

Also, DUPLICATE_SCRIPTS flag wasn't working - script was always copied because `_duplicate` looked for "script/script" property while it should be just "script".

Now "script" property is being set before all others, and "script/script" changed to `CoreStringNames::get_singleton()->_script`.

data.title: Fixes ERR_EXPLAIN being overwritten
Opening a new 3D scene makes the editor camera move to the default position instead of snapping to it
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04, Godot build: 6b99950**


**Issue description:**
When opening a scene (be it just created or loading an existent one) in the 3D editor, the editor camera will visibly move to the default position instead of snapping to it. This does not happen when switching to already loaded scenes.

data.title: Broken imported .DAE meshes.
data.body:
**Windows 10, Godot 3.0 master build (54e81c795529a9c35cc045acfb941417cf2b5008), Nvidia GeForce GTX 1050**


**Issue description:**
Imported Collada (from Blender 2.78c) meshes are broken (or just their rendering), everything worked alright in alpha 1 release. If triangulation on export is enabled things look even worse. Sometimes it gets to work properly after reimporting but not always, closing and opening editor again doesn't always help either.


**Screenshot:**
![untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1448623/30077350-dc769a84-927b-11e7-929d-aad09400dd7e.png)


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Export some model in DAE format.
2. Import it as a scene and open it.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[collada.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1278539/collada.zip)

data.title: When camera position at floating point, render will be weird
data.body:
Windows 10, Godot 2.1.3 & Godot 3 current branch

**Issue description:**
When camera position at floating point, sprite render will be weird. snap_pixel_perfect option is disabled. This doesn't happen in all cases, when H Frame = 20 and V Frame = 22, the problem doesn't occur. This affected in current branch too.

Editor View
![expectation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8519218/30076110-132196bc-92a2-11e7-9050-37db770c3ad5.JPG)

Play View

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open example project, run the bug.tscn

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Bug pixel render.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1278453/Bug.pixel.render.zip)

data.title: Fix icons for custom types in the recent & favorites lists in the create dialog
data.body:
The imported image for custom types now shows for the recent and favourites lists in the create node dialog. Fixes #10917

Currently this is done by iterating over all the custom types for each icon which isn't found with has_icon. It may be better to do a lookup directly from custom type name to the custom type data, but i couldn't find a way to do this without introducing another map and doing a bit more book keeping.

data.title: Shortcuts for hex colors
data.body:
Currently, when specifying colors, we must give 6 or 8 digits (in rrggbb[aa] form).

I suggest that there should be added the shortcut form, just like in html:

- `#abc` is the same as `#aabbcc`
- `#abcd` is the same as `#aabbccdd`

This will make it easier, mostly for grey colors made of the same hex digit, like `#777777`, it's hard to notice if you actually specified 5, 6 or 7 digits. 

Would be really nice if it was added in the next version of Godot Engine.

Thanks!

data.title: Add custom minumus height to TreeItem
data.body: And expose the method `get_drop_section_at_pos` of Tree

data.title: Ability to configure 3d camera interpolation speed
data.body:
Interpolation speed can be increased to have less [smooth]/[dizzy(?)]" experience when rotating editor camera around spatial.

**edit/update:**
I modified this pr to introduce inertia param instead (using Zylann equation). 
From user side: User can enter value from between 0-1 where 0 means 'no interpolation' and 1.0 means "more interpolation than previously". By default it's set to 0.5 which feels for me similar to how it works currently.

Under the hood those values are remapped to be between 0.0 and 0.2 since bigger number in equation are giving so big 'seasick' experience that I don't believe anyone would like to use them. 

**update2:**
I calibrated values better: https://youtu.be/e85LIZTGEns

data.title: Provide NativeScript properties in definition order
data.body:
Before this change properties of native scripts were shown in arbitrary order in the editor, and the order could even change if you focus/unfocus the editor (library gets reloaded) - very annoying.

Now the order is strict and determined by the order the properties are registered in. Base class properties go first.

data.title: Segfault on quit in project manager (memdelete<GDNativeSingletonDiscover>)
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Mageia 6 x86_64, Godot master 9b9344cab

**Issue description:**
When closing the project manager, Godot segfaults:
```
Thread 1 "godot-git" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00000000021f982a in Object::_predelete (this=0x0) at core/object.cpp:384
384             _predelete_ok = 1;

(gdb) bt
#0  0x00000000021f982a in Object::_predelete (this=0x0) at core/object.cpp:384
#1  0x0000000002204048 in predelete_handler (p_object=0x0) at core/object.cpp:1774
#2  0x0000000000d935b8 in memdelete<GDNativeSingletonDiscover> (p_class=0x0) at core/os/memory.h:107
#3  0x0000000000d922b9 in unregister_gdnative_types () at modules/gdnative/register_types.cpp:252
#4  0x0000000000d839a2 in unregister_module_types () at modules/register_module_types.gen.cpp:129
#5  0x0000000000d46193 in Main::cleanup () at main/main.cpp:1714
#6  0x0000000000d1a5f0 in main (argc=1, argv=0x7fffffffda88) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:55
```
Seems related to GDNative, cc @karroffel.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Start Godot
- Close it

data.title: Idea: Add support for a global event bus [Edit]
data.body:
## Signals / Notifications
While the signal-system in Godot works very well in many cases, there is one pattern that I'm personally missing and that is to be able to subscribe globally to signals to receive information without knowing if it will occur or which objects that are emitting it up front. This is more akin to an event system. Godot has some internal notifications that would work - but as far as I know these are predefined and mostly not for use by normal developers.

The idea that you can only connect signals explicitly through object and using 1 slot means that it is not as useful as it could be. I miss a mechanism where you can emit some signals globally and you can connect to a global queue without knowledge of objects - just events.

## Example
An example - I have a set of objects detecting various objects passing through it (like `Area`-triggers) in one scene. I want to know whenever one of the triggers were firing - both passing through them and also as part of general accumulation and updating of UI.

Currently, I see the following solutions to this problem:
1. To iterate through the scene, and connect to these explicitly. But then I consume the signal slot and block it from further access for other objects.
2. In the actual trigger detection - check if the target has a predefined method (`has_method()`) and call it if they have it. But this will imply that you need an object to enter the trigger and possibly route the fnction call further.
3. Other stuff I missed? As mentioned - the notification systems seems mostly like an internal mechanism.

## Solution suggestions
1. Create a special global queue object that everyone connect and emit to - might be messy.
2. Create new functions for this and call them something else - like *Event* or similar.
3. Expand the existing notification functionality to allow user-defined notifications.

## Edit
As pointed out by @Zylann an event bus is more descriptive of what I'm trying to achieve.
* http://timnew.me/blog/2014/12/06/typical-eventbus-design-patterns/
* http://gameprogrammingpatterns.com/event-queue.html

data.title: Fix unshaded materials render
data.body:
After commit e611ff5f0110210221a6f90250bdd65f5fb3ff2d unshaded materials are rendered pitch-black. If I'm not mistaken, that's because now `SORT_KEY_UNSHADED_FLAG` is not being set for them unless `p_depth_pass` is true.
I changed back the condition for `SORT_KEY_UNSHADED_FLAG` as it were before this commit:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/44adf75cd53c22f146fc2e2dbba7d7efab3c0a0d/drivers/gles3/rasterizer_scene_gles3.cpp#L2305-L2308
*Bugsquad edit:* Fixes #10987
